reviews.title: Coca-Cola Coliseum, Toronto, Canada
text: The way I see it, this game is not my cup of tea, but the atmosphere is lovely and enjoyable if you're with your friends. Let's go, Marlies!!!

reviews.title: Let's go Marlies
text: Really easy to visit and a good experience. I wanted to see a Maple Leaf's game whilst in Toronto but they weren't playing so we ended up going to see the Toronto Marlies instead (I think basically what would be equivalent to their division 2 / feeder team to the Leaf's) and it was a great game at a fraction of the cost. My wife has never been to a hockey game before and loved it, the atmosphere was great. The venue itself is easy to get to with food and drink stalls all around it that weren't actually that bad value. Well recommend

reviews.title: Great Venue for a Hockey game

reviews.title: Toronto Marlies! Professional hockey at a good price
text: Now know as coca cola colliseum is easy to reach by streetcar 509, stops in front the stadium. Nice atmosphere and most important i think for tourist, quality hockey for a good price. Tickets are around 30 dollars vs 150+ for the maple leafs. I don't have any knowledge about hockey, but when in Canada wanted to see a game. Looking at price this was the best option. AHL league is a good level from what i understand. Speed of the game about the same, tactical a little bit less than nhl. However i didnt notice, because i dont know nothing about tactics in hockey. Anyway i had great time and it was bobblehead night so also a free gift

reviews.title: Delicious Fries and Affordable Hockey
text: Saw the Marlies play with discounted tickets. Considering the price of Leaf games, it's a screaming bargain. Their food seems higher level than Leafs offerings as well. Had the homemade fries. At $7 for a giant box, I easily could have shared them with my friend. Love that you can see the exterior of the original building, around which they've built a modern addition. Easy to get to from downtown but expensive parking.

reviews.title: Family fun in Downtown Toronto- for a reasonable price!
text: If you like hockey and you are in Toronto, come to see the Toronto Marlies at the (newly re-named) Coca Cola Coliseum @ Exhibition place. Seeing a hockey game at the Coliseum is a wonderful, noisy, fun-filled event. Tickets are very reasonably priced and there's not a bad seat in the house. There are pre-game activities, in between period events and lots of music too. Families and groups of friends have a great time. The Marlies may not be as great as they were last year but there are some future Toronto Maple Leafs in the making. So if you visit Toronto but want to have a "small town, community feeling" then come out to a Marlies game! The Coliseum is easily accessible by public transit, GO transit and walking from Liberty Village area. Parking tip- there is a lot directly below the arena area and it is the same price (usually $15) as the surface lot. You stay warm, out of the elements and get this great deal!

reviews.title: First Marlies game
text: They do ane excellent job of making it fun and today was a teddy bear toss for charity. We had great seats by the penalty box and the Marlies lost but kept it close.
Prices are the same as ACC for food and drink but for the price it was good fun. Good value. We recommend it.
Jay

reviews.title: Royal Terrace @ Royal Horse show one of the worst
text: We attended the Royal Horse show on opening night and sat in the Royal Terrace.  The staff obviously were grabbed off the street and received no training.  No soup spoons on the table we had to ask for them, had to ask for water, they were serving from both the left and the right- no training at all.  The food was just ok but a huge disappointment from past years as they moved to a fixed menu from a buffet.  We won't be back for sure.  Whoever was hired to do the catering is an embarrassment to the Royal.

reviews.title: The Royal Horse Show
text: I was pretty much blown away by the The Royal. I've seen horse jumping on TV but this is a big deal.  Some attendees are dressed formally and I can say that I have never seen so many tuxes and gowns in one place.  Not knowing that this was the case I had on jeans and a dress shirt.  But that was OK because a good portion of the crowd was also more casual and in jeans.  It was amazing to see. My wife loves horses and this was a surprise birthday present. Even watching the set-up and measuring of the jumping course was interesting as were the other events such as the Canada vs.US in a polo exhibition. The other events also had gorgeous horses and well attired participants who seem to be masters of their craft. The riders in the main event were all world class with Olympic champions, world champions and participants from at least 7 countries.  This isn't a casual horse show at the county fair, this is the best of the best and it feels like you hold your breath and lean into the jumps and you cheer them all on - both riders and horses. The men were generally very dapper and the women were stunningly beautiful with gowns, jewels, heels and almost like a bit of a yacht club meets Kentucky Derby meets State Fair with the world class horse events, horses and riders.  Unforgettable and I'd return to Toronto just for this event. It was work to keep my jaw from dropping here.

reviews.title: Great Value
text: If you really want to see the Leafs but cannot afford the ACC, why not give the Ricoh Coliseum a go. With the Marlins, you will see the future of our beloved club.
The prices are reasonable and they make the event very entertaining.
Great value. Great fun.

reviews.title: Let's go Marlies let's go!!

The atmosphere is very good and in the right manner. Food is good and well priced. Would definitely recommend

reviews.title: Excellent venue for hockey game.
text: The arena is small and every seat is close to the ice.  They do allow in and out privileges.  Food was expensive.  I think is was $5.00 for a bag of popcorn. Staff was amazing.  They were very courteous, polite and professional.  Ricoh is the best place to watch a hockey game.

reviews.title: Grand Old Building!
text: I attend Toronto Marlies games (AHL) at Ricoh coliseum and absolutely love it! There's not a bad seat in the house, their concession stands are a little bit cheaper than the other stadiums in Toronto and they have a great selection of food. You can get stir-fry to eat while watching the game! No stir-fry in ACC!! It's always a little bit cold in there during hockey games so winter clothing is a must have. Hat and coat. Lots of cheap parking outside and underground. I love this place, it's not as modern or classy as the ACC but it's a hundred year old building so it has it's own charm.

reviews.title: Future Leafs
text: A ticket for the Leafs are ridiculous and for those without the benefit of a corporate seat/box or if you just missed winning the lottery, it is a pricey ticket.

But being a hockey fan did not stop me from seeing the Marlies. There are several up and coming Leafs on this team. The action is fast and the seating is not bad. The fans are hockey fans who simply want to see the action live.
Ricoh is comfortable and the seating is great. For those on a tighter budget, this is a nice venue and should be considered.
The players are fun to watch and it is worth the price of admission.

reviews.title: Marlies game
text: Went to my first Marlies game and I can‚Äôt figure out why i waited this long.  Tickets were $70 each and we were 3 rows back from the glass.  The skill level is surprisingly good and since the players are pretty much the same size as the nhl players you still get big hits and exciting hockey. reviews.title: Marlies Hockey
text: Great venue for hockey. There isn't really a bad seat or standing room in the arena. There are plenty of food vendors inside. Food is reasonably priced and a good variety. The beer and wine is expensive, but what arena isn't. The average crowd is 6000 people and the arena clears out easily after the game including the parking lots. Great place to bring kids, lots of entertainment and give aways during breaks. They hold many theme nights during the season. The only downfall with the venue is there are no restaurants or bars outside the arena in Exhibition Place to go before the or after the game, you have to leave the site and go to Liberty Village about a 15 minute walk or 10 minute drive. Marlies.ca

reviews.title: Hockey game
text: Been to many AHL arenas and this place is amazing. Amazing architecture outside and inside a great rink. Seats comfortable and great views all around.

reviews.title: Tyler the Creator Concert
text: Great venue for a concert. Tyler put in an awesome show. I have been here before to see Medieval Times as well. Always super packed before or after concert but able to grab a can and just a few steps from a Go Train.

reviews.title: Royal Winter Fair
text: We were in Toronto only for the Royal and every year the horse show is amazing! There is a huge variety of vendors at the show from food to horses! Every seat is a great view of the event taking place. Though the place is packed with cattle, chickens, bunnies, dogs and horses, they keep the place very clean!
